item.description: Agile Project Management Agile is a set of project management principles that focuses on people, products, and tools to by encourage an iterative approach for speedy turnover on product delivery.
Artifacts (Scrum) Artifacts are key sources of information required to progress the development of a product under the [[LDP/600 Resources/Scrum (Agile)]] methodology.
Ceremonies (Scrum) Ceremonies in [[LDP/600 Resources/Scrum (Agile)|Scrum]] are a fancy word for the types of goal-oriented meetings to prepare for and reflect on work.

Kanban (Agile) Kanban is an adaptation of [[LDP/600 Resources/Agile Project Management]] and is a workflow methodology of continuous that uses a visual aid to help organize and limit work that may be invisible to increase work efficiency.

Kanban vs Scrum [[LDP/600 Resources/Kanban (Agile)|Kanban]] and [[LDP/600 Resources/Scrum (Agile)|Scrum]] are different takes on [[LDP/600 Resources/Agile Project Management|Agile]]. Both are similar in this aspect, but they have nuanced approaches and workflows that support different environments.
Work Hierarchy (Scrum) Work (tasks) are simplified to three tiers, but can have more. From lowest to highest: (User) Stories, Epics, Initiatives.
